newsitem.title: FRANCE: Israel's Shamir taken ill in Paris.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Shamir taken ill in Paris.

text.p: Former Israeli prime minister Yitzhak Shamir was taken ill during a visit to Paris on Friday and cancelled a news conference, aides said.
Shamir, who turns 81 on October 15, was giving an interview to a French television station at his hotel when he suffered a drop in blood pressure, they said.
A doctor examined him at the hotel and advised him to curtail his activities, but he did not require hospital treatment, they said.
"He is tired, as a man aged over 80 can be," an official of the French branch of his right-wing Likud party said.
Shamir, a former Jewish underground fighter and spymaster who was a hardline prime minister from 1986 to 1992, is on a European fundraising tour for the Jewish National Fund (Keren Kayemet).
